docs.lead_paragraph: THE effect of alcohol upon infant mortality is appalling." That is the verdict of Dr. J. Wallace Beveridge of the Cornell Medical College -- a verdict that he reached after years of close observation in hospitals, and one that has been affirmed by a long series of laboratory experiments.

headline.main: ALCOHOL'S APPALLING EFFECT ON INFANT MORTALITY; Dr. J. Wallace Beveridge of the Cornell University Medical College Declares That the Consumption of Spirituous Liquors by Parents Materially Reduces the Birthrate, Particularly That Its Use by Mothers of Babies Results in Infant Disease and Death.
